required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Multicenter Trial To Evaluate The Efficacy And Safety Of A Fesoterodine Flexible Dose Regimen In Patients With Overactive Bladder.

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 3B study is designed to test if a fesoterodine flexible dose regimen is more effective than placebo in reducing micturition frequency and other overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms, e.g., urgency, urgency incontinence episodes in patients with overactive bladder and if the fesoterodine regimen is safe and well tolerated.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Number of Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours at Week 12 Relative to Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Number of Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Number of Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Number of Severe Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Number of Urgency Urinary Incontinence (UUI) Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Nocturnal Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Number of Nocturnal Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Frequency-urgency Sum Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
Change in Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) at Week 12 Relative to Baseline - Symptom Bother Scale
Change in Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) at Week 12 Relative to Baseline - Health Related Quality of Life (HRQL) Subscales
Categorical Change in Patient Perception of Bladder Condition (PPBC) Score Relative to Baseline
Categorical Change in Urgency Perception Scale (UPS) Relative to Baseline
Change in Urgency Severity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Relative to Baseline

intervention.description: 4mg tablets once daily for 2 weeks, then either 4mg or 8mg tablets once daily for 10 weeks. Subjects were instructed to take 1 tablet every evening within 4 hours prior to bedtime with water, swallowed whole without chewing.
Matched placebo tablets once daily for 12 weeks. Subjects were instructed to take 1 tablet every evening within 4 hours prior to bedtime with water, swallowed whole without chewing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overactive bladder symptoms for greater than or equal to 3 months.
- Mean urinary frequency of greater than or equal to 8 micturitions per 24 hours in bladder diary.
- Mean number of Urgency episodes greater than or equal to 3 per 24 hours in bladder diary.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to fesoterodine (antimuscarinics).
- Known etiology of OAB (e.g., neurogenic, local urinary tract pathology).
- Previous history of acute urinary retention requiring catheterization or severe voiding difficulties in the judgment of the investigator, prior to baseline.
- Unable to follow the study procedures, including completion of self-administered bladder diary and patient reported outcome questionnaires.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were screened at 90 centers in the United States; in 88 centers, participants were randomized.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study consisted of a 2-week no-treatment screening period and a 12-week double-blind treatment period. Participants with bothersome overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms who met all entry criteria at baseline (end of screening) were randomized.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

participants_list.participants: 88 completed on matched 4mg dose and 297 on matched 8mg dose
134 completed on 4mg dose and 248 on 8mg dose

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in Mean Number of Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours at Week 12 Relative to Baseline.
outcome.description: The number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all micturitions divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit. Change: mean at Week 12 minus mean at Baseline
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF)). The FAS included all participants who took at least 1 dose of assigned study drug and had at least 1 valid efficacy assessment, either at baseline or post baseline.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Change in Mean Number of Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours at Week 12 Relative to Baseline.
measure.description: The number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all micturitions divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit. Change: mean at Week 12 minus mean at Baseline
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF)). The FAS included all participants who took at least 1 dose of assigned study drug and had at least 1 valid efficacy assessment, either at baseline or post baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: the mean change from baseline in micturitions per 24 hours in the fesoterodine group is the same as in the placebo group at Week 12. A sample size of 350 in each arm had at least 85% power to detect a difference of 0.8 between flexible dose fesoterodine & placebo assuming a standard deviation of 3.52 using a 2-sample t-test with a 0.05 2-sided significance level. Accounting for 10% of randomized subjects not having the primary endpoint data, 390 subjects were needed in each arm
analysis.method_desc: Terms for treatment, center and baseline as covariate and baseline by treatment interaction.
analysis.estimate_desc: The LS mean difference & 95% CI were calculated at mean baseline = 12.9 (centered baseline used in model)

outcome.title: Change in Mean Number of Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: The number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all micturitions divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit. Change: mean at observation minus mean at baseline
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 2 or Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]). The FAS included all participants who took at least 1 dose of assigned study drug and had at least 1 valid efficacy assessment, either at baseline or post baseline (n=placebo; n=fesoterodine)

measure.description: The number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all micturitions divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit. Change: mean at observation minus mean at baseline

analysis.estimate_desc: Since centered baseline was used in the model, the LS mean difference and its 95% CI were calculated at mean baseline

analysis.estimate_desc: Since centered baseline was used in the model, the LS mean difference and its 95% CI were calculated at mean baseline

outcome.title: Change in Number of Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Change in number of urgency episodes (urinary sensation scale [USS] rating of 3 or more) recorded in the bladder diary. Scale: 0=no feeling of urgency to 5=unable to hold; leak urine. The number of urgency episodes per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all urgency episodes divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit.
outcome.population: Number of subjects with Baseline Urgency Episodes >0 per 24 hours and non missing change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF). Only subjects with at least 1 episode during baseline 3-day diary period were included in analysis.

Number of severe urgency episodes per 24 hours calculated as sum of all severe urgency episodes divided by total number of diary days collected at that visit.

outcome.title: Change in Nocturnal Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Change in number of nocturnal micturitions (NM) recorded in the bladder diary. NM were defined as micturitions that occurred between the time the subject went to bed and the time he or she arose to start the next day. The number of NM per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all NM divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit.
outcome.population: Number of subjects with Baseline Nocturnal Micturitions >0 per 24 and non-missing change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF). Only subjects with at least 1 episode during baseline 3-day diary period were included in analysis.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Change in Nocturnal Micturition Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
measure.description: Change in number of nocturnal micturitions (NM) recorded in the bladder diary. NM were defined as micturitions that occurred between the time the subject went to bed and the time he or she arose to start the next day. The number of NM per 24 hours was calculated as the sum of all NM divided by the total number of diary days collected at that visit.
measure.population: Number of subjects with Baseline Nocturnal Micturitions >0 per 24 and non-missing change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF). Only subjects with at least 1 episode during baseline 3-day diary period were included in analysis.

outcome.title: Change in Number of Nocturnal Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Change in number of nocturnal urgency episodes (NUE) recorded in bladder diary. NUE had urinary sensation scale (USS) rating of 3 or more that occurred between time subject went to bed and time he or she arose to start next day. Number of NUE per 24 hours was calculated as sum of all NUE divided by total number of diary days collected at that visit
outcome.population: Number of subjects with Nocturnal Urgency Episodes >0 per 24 hours and non-missing change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF). Only subjects with at least 1 episode during baseline 3-day diary period were included in analysis.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Change in Number of Nocturnal Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
measure.description: Change in number of nocturnal urgency episodes (NUE) recorded in bladder diary. NUE had urinary sensation scale (USS) rating of 3 or more that occurred between time subject went to bed and time he or she arose to start next day. Number of NUE per 24 hours was calculated as sum of all NUE divided by total number of diary days collected at that visit
measure.population: Number of subjects with Nocturnal Urgency Episodes >0 per 24 hours and non-missing change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF). Only subjects with at least 1 episode during baseline 3-day diary period were included in analysis.

outcome.title: Change in Frequency-urgency Sum Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Change in frequency urgency sum is total urinary sensation scale (USS) ratings recorded for all micturitions in 24-hour day. Number of USS ratings per 24 hours is sum of all USS ratings divided by the total diary days collected at that visit. USS scale: 1=No feeling of urgency to 5=Unable to hold:leak urine. Numerical decrease indicates improvement
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 or Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]). Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Change in Frequency-urgency Sum Per 24 Hours Relative to Baseline
measure.description: Change in frequency urgency sum is total urinary sensation scale (USS) ratings recorded for all micturitions in 24-hour day. Number of USS ratings per 24 hours is sum of all USS ratings divided by the total diary days collected at that visit. USS scale: 1=No feeling of urgency to 5=Unable to hold:leak urine. Numerical decrease indicates improvement
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 or Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]). Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

outcome.title: Change in Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) at Week 12 Relative to Baseline - Symptom Bother Scale
outcome.description: Each item rated by subject on a Likert scale 1 (least symptom bother) to 6 (most symptom bother). Raw scores were transformed to a score from 0 to 100. Once transformed a negative change indicates improvement. Change: mean at Week 12 minus mean at baseline
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 12. The FAS included all participants who took at least 1 dose of assigned study drug and had at least 1 valid efficacy assessment, either at baseline or post baseline

outcome.title: Categorical Change in Patient Perception of Bladder Condition (PPBC) Score Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: PPBC scale range: 1=does not cause me any problems at all to 6=causes me many severe problems. Major improvement=negative score change of 2 or more from baseline; minor improvement=negative score change of 1 or more from baseline; no change=0 score change from baseline; Deterioration=positive score change from baseline
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing baseline values and Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF) values. Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Categorical Change in Patient Perception of Bladder Condition (PPBC) Score Relative to Baseline
measure.description: PPBC scale range: 1=does not cause me any problems at all to 6=causes me many severe problems. Major improvement=negative score change of 2 or more from baseline; minor improvement=negative score change of 1 or more from baseline; no change=0 score change from baseline; Deterioration=positive score change from baseline
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing baseline values and Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF) values. Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

analysis.method_desc: The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.
The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.
The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.

outcome.title: Categorical Change in Urgency Perception Scale (UPS) Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: UPS scores range from 0 ("I am usually not able to hold urine") to 2 ("I am usually able to finish what I am doing before going to the toilet [without leaking]"). Improvement: positive score change; No change: score change=0; Deterioration: negative score change
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing baseline values and Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF) values. Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

measure.title: Categorical Change in Urgency Perception Scale (UPS) Relative to Baseline
measure.description: UPS scores range from 0 ("I am usually not able to hold urine") to 2 ("I am usually able to finish what I am doing before going to the toilet [without leaking]"). Improvement: positive score change; No change: score change=0; Deterioration: negative score change
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing baseline values and Week 2, Week 6 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) or Week 12 (LOCF) values. Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF.

analysis.method_desc: The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.
The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.
The CMH test used modified ridit scores which were based on the ranks of the observations rather than the observed values.

outcome.title: Change in Urgency Severity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: The urgency severity VAS Scale records the subjects assessment of the severity of urgency. VAS scale ranges from 1 Very Mild to 10 Very Severe. Negative change indicated improvement. Change: mean at observation minus mean at baseline.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 or Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]). Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF

measure.title: Change in Urgency Severity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Relative to Baseline
measure.description: The urgency severity VAS Scale records the subjects assessment of the severity of urgency. VAS scale ranges from 1 Very Mild to 10 Very Severe. Negative change indicated improvement. Change: mean at observation minus mean at baseline.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) with non-missing numerical change from baseline to Week 2, Week 6 or Week 12 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]). Number analyzed=participants at Week 12 LOCF

analysis.method_desc: Terms for center, treatment and baseline covariate
Terms for center, treatment and baseline covariate
Terms for center, treatment and baseline covariate

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with placebo once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained as placebo once daily or changed to matching placebo (for 8 mg) once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

group.title: Fesoterodine
group.description: All randomized participants were treated with fesoterodine 4mg once daily for the first 2 weeks of treatment. The dose remained at 4 mg once daily or increased to 8 mg once daily for the next 10 weeks based on discussion between investigator and participant.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
